alert.note: Alert for Marshall (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 15 at 9:07PM CDT until April 18 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota... Wild Rice River (MN) at Hendrum affecting Norman County. Marsh River at Shelly affecting Norman County. Snake River below Warren affecting Marshall County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Snake River AT Alvarado affecting Marshall County. South Branch Buffalo River at Sabin affecting Clay County. Buffalo River near Dilworth affecting Clay County. Buffalo River near Hawley affecting Clay County. Red Lake River at Crookston affecting Polk County. Two Rivers River near Hallock affecting Kittson County. .Snowmelt river flooding to continue. Rate of rise and ultimate crest is uncertain due to rate of ongoing snowmelt runoff and possible rain and colder temperatures in the forecast. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON TO TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Snake River AT Alvarado. * WHEN...From Monday afternoon to Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 106.0 feet, MINOR FLOOD STAGE. Storm sewer flood gates are closed. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 102.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 106.0 feet early Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 106.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
